title: Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain angers Man Utd fans with exchange on sidelines
text:
Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain tried to fist-bump a Manchester United fan (NBC)

Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain was involved in a brief altercation with Manchester United supporters following Liverpool’s 1-1 draw at Old Trafford on Sunday.

Marcus Rashford put Ole Gunnar Solskjaer’s side ahead in the first half but the Premier League leaders earned a point as Adam Lallana scored an equaliser in the 85th minute.

Oxlade-Chamberlain came on as a substitute in the second half but as he was leaving the pitch after the final whistle, he responded to abuse from United fans near the tunnel.

The 26-year-old offered to fist-bump one United fan to told him repeatedly to ‘f*** off’, while another supporter who was filming the incident pulled his fist away from the Liverpool midfielder.

These United fans weren't so welcoming after giving Ox shit when he was warming up 😂😂😂😂😂😂😂 pic.twitter.com/wXs3nN00cy — Matthew (@Matt2860) October 20, 2019

Meanwhile, Jurgen Klopp was furious that Rashford’s goal was allowed to stand as Liverpool felt Divock Origi had been fouled by Victor Lindelof in the build up.

‘The result is okay,’ said the Liverpool manager.

‘It’s not what we wanted but we have to be happy given how the game developed.

Liverpool wanted Marcus Rashford’s goal ruled out (PA Wire)

‘The first half I didn’t like because we gave Man United the chance to do what they want to do – to put us under pressure and be aggressive.

‘They were not better than we were but they did what they wanted to do.

‘They scored a goal which shows all the problems with VAR.

‘Mr Atkinson let the game run I’m sure because there is VAR. For me it was a clear foul.

‘It’s a general problem. VAR looks and says ‘you decided like this’. But it was a foul. Then we scored a goal that was disallowed.

‘Pretty much everything went against us but we still didn’t lose so that is OK.’
